newsitem.title: CHINA: Confidence growing in Hong Kong economy - poll.
newsitem.headline: Confidence growing in Hong Kong economy - poll.

text.p: Hong Kong people are growing more confident in the territory's economic future, a survey has found.
The study, by Survey Research Hong Kong, polled more than 1,000 people from July 7 to 11, less than two weeks after Britain handed its colony back to China.
The survey, commissioned by the South China Morning Post, found almost 30 percent of respondents rating the economic outlook as good, up 10 percent from a survey in April.
The poll found 61 percent of respondents rated the economic outlook as average and 10 percent rated it bad.
Political confidence was unaffected by the handover, the poll indicated. The survey's confidence index remained at 95 points, the same as throughout 1997.
Some 79 percent of respondents expressed overall confidence in the years ahead, it said.
Hong Kong returned to China on July 1 after more than 150 years of British rule.
